title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
**Can you engineer a brighter tomorrow?**


It’s crystal clear: the actions we take in the next few years will significantly impact our future. At Volvo Cars, we embrace change. We’re committed to transforming the automotive industry and leading in electrification. For this, we’re seeking out more creative minds to shape that future. Don’t miss this opportunity to create your tomorrow.

  


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



At Volvo cars, Manufacturing Engineering Propulsion Components, you are part of a global team that makes sure that the Electric Axel X Drive (EAxD) we build meet the highest expectations from our customers. In close collaboration with colleagues in other business units, we develop and implement flexible and efficient products and processes with people in focus. If you want to reach your personal goals together with other people, Manufacturing Engineering is the place for you to prosper.


We offer you an exciting challenge in an international and growing company with a strong culture and great development opportunities. You will have the opportunity and responsibility to actively contribute to the growth of our business through people. Come join us!

  

  

Manufacturing Engineering Propulsion Components at Volvo Cars prepares and implements quality assured flexible and effective production systems in our plants globally. You are part of a group working close to all our elements within the chain of developing- construction- manufacturing and containing process.


**What you'll do**
------------------



Within Manufacturing Engineering, we are now looking for a Commodity Manufacturing Engineer who will lead the cross technical product and process manufacturing work. You will represent Manufacturing both in early and industrialization phase within the EAxD-area, with global strategic responsibility. It is also within your role to ensure product and process feedback to R&D, in order to fulfil the manufacturing attributes: quality, man hours, cost efficiency, environment, change over and flexibility.


At Commodity Manufacturing Engineering you are the owner of product and method over time, by developing, defining and preparing each system the whole life cycle. This means you are responsible for verification of assembly solutions, both virtual and physical, and you will always strive for commonality within all our plants.


**What you'll bring**
---------------------



We are looking for a committed and positive, pro-active engineer, who is passionate about cars. The right candidate is an analytical and target-oriented person with an open-mind attitude. Thanks to your excellent communication skills you have the ability to create strong and trustful relationships. Your background is a Bachelor or Master degree within Engineering or similar. You have knowledge about 6 Sigma and Lean Production as well as good understanding of the software we are using (Teamcenter) and you are fluent in English.

  

  

We are looking for a candidate with previous experience from production processes and product development, preferably from automotive. Geometrical knowledge as well experience within automation assembly is meritorious. In addition, your personality will be of outmost importance. Position is located in Skövde or Gothenburg.


“Dare to be curious, dare to be different, dare to think differently, and dare to make a difference!”

  



**Ready to Take the Next Step?**


Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.

  

  

**Volvo Cars – driving change together**


Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Senior Sound Designer
description:
About the job
SummaryBy Outscal

**1 skill required for this role**
----------------------------------


Boost these skills to join the top 1% applicants for this job
Reaper**Test Your Skills****Add These Skills****Must have:**


* Solid experience as a sound designer or audio engineer in the gaming industry.
* Strong understanding of sound principles and techniques.
* Proficiency in audio middleware such as FMOD.
* Experience with digital audio workstations (DAWs) and audio editing software (Reaper is a plus).
* Effective communication skills, with the ability to collaborate within cross-discipline teams.
* Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English.

**Not hearing back from companies?**


Unlock the secrets to a successful job application and accelerate your journey to your next opportunity.**Take Quiz Now**


At Avalanche Studios Group, we are looking for a Senior Sound Designer to join our audio team to work on the world's biggest and best hunting game; theHunter: Call of the Wild.  

As a Sound Designer you will be part of a tight and highly motivated team that strives to create the best sound experiences possible in games. theHunter is a truly immersive experience for players who enjoy an authentic depiction of wilderness and we see sound as a crucial part of the whole experience.  

Challenges include working with proprietary tools including the Apex game engine and our own modular audio framework, and utilizing these tools along with the audio engine to design and implement sounds into our game.  

Our ideal team member will have a healthy balance of creative and technical problem solving abilities, as both will be needed for the role. Half of a game’s audio quality is determined by implementation, and as a Sound Designer you’ll be responsible for both creating and implementing your own sounds.### **What you’ll do**

+ Collaborate with Sound Designers and Audio Programmers to implement and optimize sound assets within FMOD and our proprietary game engine.
+ Design, implement and maintain complex audio systems, such as dynamic mixing, environmental effects, and spatial audio, to enhance player immersion
+ Work closely with feature teams to define technical requirements and constraints for audio implementation, ensuring alignment with game design goals.
+ Playtest and iterate on audio implementations to achieve the desired emotional impact and gameplay feedback.
+ Document and communicate best practices and technical guidelines for sound.
### **Who you are**

+ Solid experience as a sound designer or audio engineer in the gaming industry, with a strong understanding of sound principles and techniques.
+ Proficiency in audio middleware such as FMOD, as well as digital audio workstations (DAWs) and audio editing software (Reaper is a plus).
+ Effective communication skills, with the ability to collaborate within cross-discipline teams.
+ Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English and with great communication and collaboration skills.
*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.* **The Stockholm location**  

Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp. **Our values**  

At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity. **How to apply**  

To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
View Full Job Description

title: Senior Quality engineer
description:

We are looking for a skilled Quality engineer who can help our client to evolve their quality assurance. As a QA engineer you will initially jump in and help out with manual tests but in the long run the focus will shift to automation.


Responsibilities* Drive the software quality assurance lifecycle within Agile methodologies
* Design, implement, and coordinate test strategies and plans with development/product teams

Your experience will be a valuable asset* **Experience from Mobile app testing (iOS and Android) is a must (candidates without this experience will not be considered)**

Start: ASAP  

Length: 6 months plus possibility to extend.  

Workplace: from office in Stockholm, hybrid set up with a couple of days onsite.

title: Senior Software Test Engineer
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **8+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

  

Rollbeskrivning:

**Purpose**


We have an exciting opportunity for you to be part of the development of the next generation infotainment system using Google's Android automotive OS. At our client, quality is not just a metric but a mindset that is deeply ingrained in their culture and respect for their customers. If you're passionate about delivering high-quality software products that meet the needs of customers, join their team of talented software developers in Lindholmen!

**Who you are**


You are customer-focused and passionate about creating top-notch solutions that improve customers' lives! With your strong analytical skills, you are able to evaluate complex problems and identify feasible solutions. Your natural curiosity and creativity enable you to think outside the box, and your cooperative approach allows you to work seamlessly with cross-functional teams to achieve common goals.

**What you'll do**


As a Software Test Engineer, you will be part of a team that ensures our software products meet the client’s quality standards. You will create and run test plans and test cases, track software bugs, and work with developers to fix issues. You will also perform regression testing to maintain product stability, build automated test scripts, and participate in code reviews. Additionally, you will improve test methodologies and work with continuous integration systems for seamless software deployment.

**Knowledge and experience**


We're looking for someone with at least a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or equivalent experience. You must have previous experience in quality assurance of complex embedded systems and familiarity with test automation tools such as Pytest, Robot, and Selenium. It is also required that you have a valid Swedish driver's license (B). Knowledge in tools such as CANoe and CANalyzer is an added advantage.


Having experience in automotive and infotainment systems will be viewed as a meritorious qualification for this position.

**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!
